quiz.title: Sentence Transformation
quiz.instruction: Rewrite the sentence using the given word, keeping the same meaning.

transformations.original: I haven't seen him for three years.
answer: The last time I saw him was three years ago.
I last saw him three years ago.
transformations.explain: We use 'last' to indicate the most recent time something happened. 'The last time I saw him was...' or 'I last saw him...' both work here.

transformations.original: She is too young to drive a car.
answer: She is not old enough to drive a car.
She isn't old enough to drive a car.
transformations.explain: 'Too young to' can be transformed to 'not old enough to'. Remember: too + adjective + to = not + opposite adjective + enough + to

transformations.answer: They have lived here for 14 years.
transformations.explain: 'Since' indicates a starting point in time, while 'for' indicates a duration. Calculate the years from 2010 to present.

transformations.original: It's a pity I don't have a car.
answer: I wish I had a car.
I wish I had a car.
transformations.explain: We use 'I wish + past simple' to express regret about present situations. The past tense 'had' doesn't refer to past time but to an unreal present.

transformations.original: Nobody has ever spoken to me like that before.
answer: This is the first time anyone has spoken to me like that.
It's the first time anyone has spoken to me like that.
transformations.explain: 'This/It is the first time + present perfect' is used to express that something has never happened before.
